# INGetVisualCodeIntent

**Class**

A request for a visual code to use for exchanging payment and contact information.

## Declaration

```swift
class INGetVisualCodeIntent
```

## Overview

Siri creates an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INGetVisualCodeIntent] object when the user asks for a visual code to use with a scanner. A visual code is a bar code or QR code that embeds information about a transaction. For example, an app might provide a visual code to facilitate payment for services. Apps can also use visual codes to communicate a user’s contact information.

To handle this intent, the handler object in your Intents extension must adopt the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INGetVisualCodeIntentHandling] protocol. Your handler should confirm the request and create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INGetVisualCodeIntentResponse] object with an image containing the visual code. Siri handles the display of the provided visual code in order to scan it.

### Additional Intent Attributes

The following table lists additional attributes of this intent object:



When performing a search, Siri automatically asks the user to unlock a currently locked device. You don’t need to explicitly ask to unlock the device. In addition, Siri always prompts the user to confirm the request before asking your Intents extension to handle it.

- **init(visualCodeType:)**: Initializes the intent object with information about the requested type of code.

## Getting the Visual Code Type

- **visualCodeType**: The type of visual code requested by the user.
- **INVisualCodeType**: Constants indicating the purpose of the visual code.

## Visual Codes

- **INGetVisualCodeIntentHandling**: The handler interface for displaying your app’s visual codes.
- **INGetVisualCodeIntentResponse**: Your app’s response to a request for a visual code.
